section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 16. Chapter 16: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period > g. Stillbirth

content.full_text: Code P95, Stillbirth, is only for use in institutions that maintain separate records for stillbirths. No other code should be used with P95. Code P95 should not be used on the mother's record. (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61-L62)
content.summary: P95 Stillbirth code is only for institutions with separate stillbirth records, used alone, and not on maternal records (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61-L62)
key_concepts: Institutional requirement for separate records (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61)
Exclusive code usage (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
Maternal record exclusion (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)

detailed_rules.rule_text: P95 is only for use in institutions that maintain separate records for stillbirths (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: The stillbirth code is restricted to healthcare institutions that have established separate record-keeping systems specifically for stillbirth cases (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61)
common_applications: Hospitals with separate stillbirth record systems
Institutions with dedicated fetal death documentation

detailed_rules.rule_text: No other code should be used with P95 (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: P95 is a standalone code that should not be combined with any other ICD-10-CM codes on the same record (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
common_applications: Stillbirth records with P95 as only code

detailed_rules.rule_text: P95 should not be used on the mother's record (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: The stillbirth code is specific to fetal records and should never appear on maternal medical records (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
common_applications: Maternal records use different codes for fetal death

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm institution maintains separate stillbirth records
Step 2: Verify this is a stillbirth case
Step 3: Confirm this is not the mother's record
Step 4: Assign P95 as the only code
Step 5: Do not assign any additional codes

specific_codes.context: Only for institutions with separate stillbirth records

coding_scenarios.scenario: Hospital maintains separate stillbirth records, fetal death at 38 weeks gestation
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Fetal death at 38 weeks gestation. Institution maintains separate records for stillbirths per policy.
step_by_step: Step 1: Confirm institution has separate stillbirth record system
Step 2: Verify this is a stillbirth case
Step 3: Confirm this is the fetal record, not maternal
Step 4: Assign P95 as the only code

correct_coding.rationale: P95 used alone in institutions with separate stillbirth records (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61-L62)

incorrect_coding.rationale: No other codes should be used with P95

warnings: P95 should not be used on mother's record (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
No other codes should be used with P95 (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
best_practices: Only use P95 in institutions with separate stillbirth records (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61)
Use P95 as standalone code only (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
common_mistakes: Using P95 without separate record system
tips: P95 is institutional policy dependent (Evidence: pg no: 74, L61)
P95 is exclusive - no other codes (Evidence: pg no: 74, L62)
implementation_notes: Requires institutional policy for separate stillbirth records
clinical_context: Fetal death documentation in specialized record systems
